citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
In May 2023, the IACUC was notified that a Principal Investigator (PI) had utilized 8 minipigs on a range-finding protocol
that was approved for dogs but not for use on pigs. Modifications in the protocol were not submitted nor approved prior to
animal usage. It was reported that there were no adverse effects in the minipigs.
IACUC review and approval of proposed animal activities is important for ensuring oversight of animal care and use at the
facility, and compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, shall: review
and approve, require modifications in or withhold approval of those components of proposed activities related to the care
and use of animals.
Corrected prior to inspection.
Corrective actions included changing the SOP for protocol approval, retraining of staff, and submission of a revised
protocol for a study in pigs.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian and IACUC Chair.
Additional Inspectors:
REBECCA NANNEY, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
